Pay for this, pay for that, etc.  They catered to women and only a select, tiny subset of successful men who received the vast majority of matches while the average man received no attention as the algorithms pushed average men to the back of the deck.  Dating apps intentionally skew your matches to minimize your chances of actually meeting someone.Countless bot/fake female accounts, IG promoter ghost accounts, OF promoter accounts, etc.  Men are turning their backs to dating apps that waste their time and take their money. And that will take a lot of time.Stop treating men like trash and start catering to actually helping people.  Then maybe men will return.

Well done! But note that holding to zero is not optimal. For short positions, if the spread divided by the sale price of the stock is u, and you are trading with a leverage of L, it's optimal to close and reopen at every drop in the sale price of the stock of v times the sale price, where v is given by:v = sqrt[2 u/(L + 1)] + (4 L - 1)/[3 (L + 1)] u + terms of order u^(3/2) and higher that we can ignore.This is the way I'm currently trading my shorts for the VIX and many other shorts. In my case v is typically 4%. I then calculate beforehand what the value of the closed position will be at the take profit point. The positions are all opened at 5 times leverage but the leverage is then lowered by adding collateral which makes the leverage about 1.5. This then means that I need to take the total value of the position and multiply that by 1.5, which gives me the exposure of the future position I want to open. That position will be opened at a leverage of 5, so I divide that exposure by 5. I can then set an order for opening that position at the desired point for that amount at a leverage of 5. And as soon as that order is executed, I can then add the amount of collateral needed to move the stop loss away so that it becomes a leverage 1.5 position. If the order is executed at exactly the right point, then the total amount of money in the position, including the collateral will be exactly the value of the old position at closure.
